text: <@U02618EV1>: I migrated all of the images on work and blog pages to be served from cloudfront URLs rather than the s3 bucket.
All future images uploaded through the CMS will be given cloudfront urls
Nice
it is up to you at this point to update the home page.
those are all statically linked images
Or just use it for hercules
Is the API pointing to the new URLs?
in what way?
When you upload an image for anything in the CMS - the API returns URLs that point to cloudFront instead of galapi
and then I scrubbed all people, work, and blog post content in the database and replaced all images with galapi URLs to be cloudfront urls
Oh, I get it now.
It's huge.
no kiding.
I think it was added right before you added the image compression module.
yeah, it must have been...  I know it took them a long time to write it, so it was atleast started before then.
Haha... 4.7mb for that one image.
there's another one further down that is 5.1mb
it's a really nice photo of us
I'll compress it manually and upload later.
I love it.
Although the one with Evans in front of that german car takes the cake.
OK. I compressed the 4 images that were a little too big. We went from 11.8MB to 1.7MB. Not bad.
<@U0289USNA> Looks like Galapagos won't let us upload gif files to blog posts.
Just a heads-up <@U026E0ZNR> and I will probably bug you about this tomorrow.
<@U026E0ZNR|trent> has joined the channel

<@U02618EV1>: that's no problem to support.  I can add a pass-through for .gifs the same way that I added a pass-through for SVG.   We will need to have a known policy though that .gifs are for animation only and will not be resized.
That's awesome. Thanks Scott.
